Reviews.Title: “Third stay as good as the others”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1824
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Mirasierra in Madrid and I can say I was not disappointed.  This was my 3rd stay at the hotel and this time round I stayed for 2 nights. I arrived late due to a delayed flight and  Javier on the front desk could not have been more helpful. I was upgraded to a room on the club floor on the 10th floor. The rooms largely appear to be the same on all floors. All have plenty of space with microwave, large fridge and coffee making machine. The bathroom was equally of a good size as previously experienced. Breakfast could be taken in either the Club Lounge or in the main restaurant as preferred. Good selection of cereals, cold meats, cheese and  fresh fruit as well as some hot selections. The Club Lounge is spacious and despite the hotel being full there was hardly any other guests using it. Free soft drinks, wine and beers are available all day with a selection of nibbles. The staff could not have been more helpful during my stay and I still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax, stylish”
Reviews.Author: Mighty83
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I stayed. Not really because of the extraordinary facilities or high standards. The public areas, the rooms, practically every place in the hotel was designed in great style, the staff is very friendly and helpful, food and beverage services great as well. If you are lucky you might as well meet some international celebrities... The rooms are really large with around 30-50 sqm depending on the room type and that is without the bathroom. Attentive small details in the room and amenities. All in all a great stay, recommend it for families and business travellers as well...

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend at Mirasierra”
Reviews.Author: 667Sophie
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, nice spacious room and massive bed that was extremley comfortable. There is a small fridge and microwave in the room, as well as a dining table for 4, but no plates or cutlery provided which is a bit odd. Very nice outdoor pool where towels are provided. We did not eat in the hotel but the restaurant looked good and offered outside dining. Although the hotel is not in the city centre, it is a 10 min walk to the underground station and you can get to be in Madrid within 40 minutes. Few things to note: Drinks are very expensive, gin & tonics from €20-€26 each and breakfast for 2 was around €56 If you use the spa you must have a swimming hat which costs €3.50 We upgraded our room so that spa and outside pool were included in the price, I used the outside pool everyday and nobody ever checked if this was included in my room rate. I only used the spa once in 4 days so would have been better off paying the charge on that day only. There isnt a huge selection of dining in the surrounding area. The hotel recommended 2 tapas restaurants nearby, we asked them to book a table for us, but they said they couldnt as the phones were busy. At about 9pm we took a taxi to the first restaurant which was closed so we continued to the next restaurant that they recommened and this was also closed. There didnt appear to be much else around and so we asked the taxi driver to take us back to the hotel. This trip cost us €15 and when we asked the hotel to reimburse us they were not willing to do this. They should know what is happening locally and the opening times of places they recommend to guests. They did offer us a free trip in the hotel shuttle to a different restaurant instead but this didnt make up for the wasted €15 so we refused and walked less that 5 mins to the tapas bar on the corner which the hotel didnt mention to us when we asked for restaurants in the area! Overall a very nice stay and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but large, comfortable rooms in Madrid; great for families”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with a family of four, getting a suite that overlooked the front of the hotel. Was very happy with the prompt shuttle service following a long day of international travel. The front desk was kind enough to check us in extremely early which allowed us to regulate to the time zone easily. The hotel itself is quite nice, not five-star but a solid four-star. It recently became a Sheraton and the decor looks like it's been updated a bit, especially in the lobby. Real Madrid stays here the nights before their home matches so you figure it's pretty solid. The pool area is comfortable, centered by a large round pool that is not heated and doesn't have a lot of shallow areas but is really pretty (wish there was an outdoor jacuzzi, however). There's a little bar below by the pool and many more cabanas and another bar up top by the hotel-pool entrance. The room itself was long, fitting a king bed at one end, a desk and sitting area in the middle, and a full kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator) with four-seat dining room table at the other end. The bathroom was also long and had separate shower and tub areas, two sinks, and plenty of cabinet and counter space (two separate entryways to the bathroom). Bathroom amenities were standard Sheraton fare, nothing special. We were able to fit a rollaway bed in the room quite easily. It was quiet with regards to outside noise. The reason why the room is quiet is the hotel is located in a residential suburb, very far north of Madrid's city center. It's about a 400m walk to the Herrera Oria stop (Metro line 9), so it takes a while to get into town by subway and usually requires a transfer or two. There's a small market along the way to pick up food and drink for the room. I'd say the setup is really convenient for a small family, especially access to the kitchenette for breakfasts (we did not eat in the hotel; the breakfast spread looked good but not great so we preferred to eat something quick and get moving). Good value relative to having to get two rooms or an apartment, and wanting something nice (plus, within the Starwood family).

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ogallego
Reviews.Content: This is without any doubt one of the top 5 stars hotels I have visited in all my trips. The hotel rooms are true apartments, the facilities are mind-blowing, spa&swimingpool amazing, breakfast a true Spanish culinaire experience. This is the best hotel in Madrid for a relax holiday and for business.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelx2
Reviews.Content: Recently changed to the Sheraton, so some upgrades are likely to come. I don't think they had the sweet sleeper beds yet. Room was a spacious suite with small sink and fridge. View south over the pool. It is a quiet neighbourhood about 10 min walk to the metro. Not as convenient for tourists, but easy to get to Sol by Metro. Restaurant was reasonable. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great buffet breakfast and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: anduain
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times for business and although it's not right in the centre it's not far by taxi. Our offices are 7 mins by taxi, so it's perfect. The beds are great, any of you reading my reviews will note that the bed is something I always rate and look out for. It is worth validating that they reserve the bed you ask for, again I was offered 2 singles - but this was sorted quickly and efficiently by the great staff, who didn't even mind me accidentally speaking Catalan :) The breakfast is a good buffet with good coffee and freshly squeezed orange juices. As with most hotels you have to pay for Wifi, this always gives me the hump. I recommend this hotel greatly, rooms, staff and location are great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gerard R
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week in Sheraton Madrid. The hotel room was a large suite and was extremely clean. The pool area is great and a real asset to the hotel. The staff at front desk were very helpful. The hotel is a half hour from the city centre by bus (133) which leaves every 10 mins outside the front door. The hotel is in a lovely mature neighbourhood with a great tapas bar around the corner...El 23, and a large shopping centre 10 mins walk away. Beautiful hotel !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luckily ..it got better!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireTraveller66
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered free pick up from the aiport which is one of the reasons I chose it coupled with the fact that it had a pool. I emailed the hotel beforehand to ensure smooth pick up. However, upon arrival there was no shuttle bus so I called the hotel.....there was no answer from 4/5 attempts so I had no choice but to jump in a taxi. The hotel, once informed of my predicament, did upgrade me to a club room and explained, following enquiries, that their telephone lines had in fact been down for some time!! Bizarrely, they had not been informed earlier. This is why I cannot give this hotel 5 stars at this time. This did not seem to bode well for a relaxing stay, however, the staff had done everthing they could to ensure that the rest of my stay had been relaxing by offering a very late check out the next day and a complimentary visit to the fantastic spa! There were issues trying to find loungers outside by the pool but this was a Sunday so hence maybe the pool area was more crowded than normal. The hotel has only been part of the Sheraton group for some 4-5 weeks and the general ambience of the hotel is truly 5 star. The staff could not be more helpful - I just guess I was unlucky! I recommend the hotel and I will try it again on my next visit to Madrid as I am happy to forgive slight teething problems. The huge plus is that being outside of Madrid, you get a great night's sleep which is invaluable!

Reviews.Title: “a wonder near Barajas Aiport”
Reviews.Author: idrovoviva
Reviews.Content: I just changed my mind not to stay at Westin Palace in downtown Madrid as usual, since I was all set to spend only 2 nights, so rather looked for a property from SPG around the airport, and couldn´t be more happy about my decision as I found this brand new developed facility. I was so, so glad to see for the first time that a five star hotel really appointed a Club Manager, who was taking care of me from door to door, starting at the club lounge going to my upgraded room. The staff couldn´t be more friendly, efficient and warm, this is something all the rest should learn. I bet anyone who may want to spend sometime in Madrid, you will find that this is the hotel one wants to be at! Congratulations and thank you so much for such a wonderful time I got there!

Reviews.Title: “Lush, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: KermitMissesJim
Reviews.Content: The only thing knocking the star off the rating is the distance from the most popular sites in Madrid; however, the Herrara Oria metro station is an easy walk away and that's how I connected to the many areas of Madrid that I visited. We loved the room. The bed is a comfortable king, the bathroom large and upscale. (The soaker tub takes FOREVER to fill, though.) There are two built-in wardrobes so you can unpack, and a bookcase just inside the front door to store wallet, keys, sunglasses, umbrellas. There is a dry bar, fridge, and microwave next to the dining/living area in the suite. Plenty of outlets. Sixteen light switches, which was a tad excessive. The pool and outside deck stretch the width of the hotel; both are stunning and do the hotel credit. The cabanas have double daybeds with pillows and blankets that are changed regularly. The staff were all helpful and courteous. We stayed four nights in a corner suite on the seventh floor and were delighted with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the centre but modern & comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: If you do not need to be in the centre but somewhere to the north of Madrid then this is the best hotel around. Also has a great pool and spa and sauna but for that they charge you 18euros, even if you are an SPG platinum member! The place is modern and well-maintained, it has comfortable large rooms, I think they only have suites. In my case the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The prices are at the high end but not extorsionate unless you want to have a beer on the terrace outside at night, but then the terrace really is very nice on a summer's evening. This hotel is not very old and has only just recently joined the Sheraton brand. This was highly necessary as the only place in town so far was the very expensive Westin Palace. Now all Starwood need to do is open a Four Points or an Aloft here as well.....

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel on the outskirts of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: thorhansen
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum I was greeted by the front desk manager at arrival, welcoming me and thanking me for choosing his hotel. This was a very nice touch, and much appreciated. I was also upgraded to a junior suite on the club level, with access to the club lounge, as well as free internet and a complimentary bottle of wine. The rooms are big (at least mine was), with a jacuzzi as well as a separate shower. The bed is comfortable, and the dining/sitting area of the room is functional. The hotel is however a little dark and feels outdated with a lot of dark wood, but I guess this is the Sheraton style. The bar in the courtyard is nice, but a little slow service. It took over 20 minutes just to order, and another 20 to get the check. Since it is a far bit out of Madrid with appx 40 minutes by the metro, and there is not much around to do. All in all a very good hotel, especially for an SPG Platinum member. I am definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Space and comfort under new brand”
Reviews.Author: BlueDolphinBrussels
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here in the past 4 months, the first since the hotel became a Sheraton. The large rooms (suites, really) are unchanged and continue to feature the highest possible concentration of light switches anywhere, beds reportedly have been upgraded to Sheraton standards. Staff for the most part is the same , restaurant service seems better than before and food quality remains very good. Internet and gym access are expensive (both just under 20 Euros/day) but otherwise prices for this kind of a hotel are reasonable. If the northern periphery of the city and its relative proximity (15 min drive) to the airport suit you, then this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: rgrici
Reviews.Content: I have been here for business several times and the quality of the hotel is excellent. Rooms are very big and comfortable, with plenty of space and a large bathrooms. They have a gym and swimming pools. The restaurant is very good but a bit too expensive. The area is convenient is you work in the north of Madrid. Less if you are in the centre. Excellent choice for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit”
Reviews.Author: Pyes
Reviews.Content: On our return to this hotel we did notice some very welcome changes since the Sheraton Group took over the hotel. We liked the extra movie services and more English speaking channels. It seems there are many small improvements to the hotel to make it more enjoyable ~ a more consistent service. They opened the outside pool early which was very welcome as it was 33c for most of our stay. This is where this hotel really stands apart, and it should really do more to advertise the fact that this is the only 5* hotel in Madrid with a large outdoor swimming pool. It is a wonderful area, beautifully tended gardens full of jasmine and lavender. Where you can relax on over sized daybeds - scattered with cushions and throws (which are changed a few times a day and kept spotlessly clean). Absolute bliss after a busy day in Madrid. It lends itself to true relaxation which works very well for a city break. There are one or two other hotels in Madrid with tiny pools or hotels that have swimming pools but are not as luxurious. This hotel combines both perfectly. It is much more peaceful than other city centre hotels ~ where we have stayed before and not had more than three hours sleep because of the horrendous traffic noise. Again this hotel works well if you are looking to sleep and relax as well enjoy city life. We loved the pool, the pool bar area with a very nice chap there who looked after us. We liked the fact we could be there all day relaxing and swimming, there are plenty of sun beds and places to relax and subtle ambient music. It is a great choice for families, couples, friends etc. Although the hotel does have a core of business clientele. The combination worked for everyone. The cocktail bar is a great area outside with super seating on little wooden platforms on water (not at all deep or dangerous in any way) great design actually, serving great cocktails and champagne. The restaurant was good too, although we would prefer an earlier start to dinner. The rooms are extremely spacious and have everything you need. Clean, comfortable and modern. I would prefer to see more of a feminine touch, some soft cushions and throws and some paintings on the walls would make the hotel look and feel much more luxurious. It is a small investment but definitely one I would make. Given that this is a business hotel I guess they have kept the decor low key. However the rooms could definitely benefit from a splash of colour! The kitchens are kept spotlessly clean. The one tip I have for you is to definitely book a mountain view! It is quite extraordinary the difference between the two sides of the hotel. We stayed in both, and one is full of light with amazing views of the mountains and countryside and the other is a view of apartment blocks and the swimming pool. I would recommend the mountain view without hesitation. It is also quieter without the noise from the bar or pool. A few suggestions for areas of improvement. The service in the spa needs improving ~ they need to provide treatments with proper essential oils and the treatment menu should be upgraded and more carefully considered. The products in the room at the moment are Sheraton's own brand, I would like to see Penthaligons, Molton Brown, Bulgari or something similar. Most five star hotels do in fact stock better toiletries and this would certainly be an improvement. The Sheraton brand is okay it does the job, but it is not special in any way. A few touches here or there would make this very good hotel excellent in my view. We hope you will keep the outside pool open for most of the year, it can be warm even in March and warmer still into the autumn. Personally I would keep it all year round, there are great health benefits to swimming outside in the winter. It is a great asset to the hotel. The staff are wonderful, spanish hospitality is always good, but we did find everyone to be kind and genuinely helpful. We especially liked the gardener who took the trouble to find out the names of the flowers for me and left a note in our room. What a lovely touch ~ overall we were very happy with most things, and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing city break in a quiet part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Mirasierra”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrekka
Reviews.Content: Great suite hotel (equipped with microwave, sink, coffee maker), great for business and families. 5 min walk from Herrera Oria station that takes you downtown Madrid. But be aware, you need to switch lines and it takes around 40 min to get to Puerta del Sol/city centre . The Madrid metro is easy enough to navigate though, any savvy traveller should have no problem. Ok, back to the hotel. The staff are helpful and nice, spoke perfect English as one would expect of a business hotel. Wi-fi only free in the lobby but I had trouble logging on. No matter,there are computers for your use in the lobby, just like any Sheraton. The hotel is located 10 min from the airport in a residential neighborhood. The only nightlife you'll get is the locals walking their dogs. The breakfast buffet costs around 15 euros, it's alright. Not that you have much choice in terms of cafes there.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: 187147Adh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very far from Madrid. The staff is completely unpleasant. The outside terrass was closed for painting activities.. Such as the swimming pool for several different reasons and in fact no credible reason.. No apologize from the staff and no smile at all during our stay. We were 5 persons in several rooms, and we all agreed we will never go back to this place. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Potential, Beautiful Neighborhood Setting”
Reviews.Author: EddieO1
Reviews.Content: The modern hotel may be the perfect venue for the business traveler. The free airport shuttle was great although a better communication system would make it even better. The full size desk, kitchenette and dining table are a nice fit for the extra large rooms. However, flatware and silverware would make a lot of sense and soap and toiletries should be a given. The marble bathroom and the separate shower are wonderful and the spa is just great for the overworked businessman or woman. The somewhat dated furniture is still in good shape but may be in need of a touch up. While the available WiFi in the lobby was nonexistent the room WiFi was just fine with the exception of the price. 19 Euros a day for inroom WiFi may not be a fortune but is MORE THAN THE WESTIN PALACE, the now Starwood Luxury Collection sister property across town. And while we're here let's venture a thought: if Castillo Son Vida in Palma can offer FREE WiFi across the entire property so I guess can a BUSINESS HOTEL in a beautiful but nonetheless far from central location in Madrid. The restaurant and F&B staff were just great and the food quite interesting. The huge potential of the hotel is what got my attention. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful and definitely willing to go beyond the norm. Give them the right tools and they'll turn this newly minted Sheraton into one of Madrid's finest.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: carla n
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice spacious rooms, with all you need. From coffee/ tea service to minibar. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay here very much and will sure come back when we are in the nieghborhood. The price was excellent. The shuttle from and to the airport works perfect, they even came back for us after our flight was delayed!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: AK266
Reviews.Content: So spacious and bright, with a nice street view overlooking a beautiful water/pond structure. The bathroom was almost as large as the room itself! The room also had a small kitchen and dining area for basic needs. We ate at the restaurant for dinner.. wonderful service and great food. We did have a horribly embarrassing experience at the wellness spa. The spa receptionist mumbled some vague instructions about "mandatory shower cap" while she chatted w/ another customer. She handed us a paper listing some rules and a few towels, but no further explanation. We were utterly confused, but one patron handed us *disposable shower caps* and said "on your head". We changed and entered the spa.. 30-40 people were staring back like we were aliens. We later discovered we were wearing FOOT coverings, not swimming caps!! How embarrassing. And to make things worse, we walked right past the staff.. and instead of helping us, they let us continue into the spa while mocking us. Humiliating. I have absolutely no complaints with this gorgeous hotel. Unfortunately, we had an awful experience with solely the spa aspect, which involves clients/staff not directly connected to the hotel. I hope this post initiates disciplinary action toward the wellness spa... because a client paying ~$500/night for a room at Mirasierra should not leave feeling humiliated :-/
